Have you proposed an EM schema update for this? Can you please provide the link to the patch?

Hi Andrew,
Do you mean gerrit link of EM schema modification or github link of the EM schema file path?

The properties exposed on DBus by EM are an ABI that needs to be agreed on by both EM and any consuming applications such as those in dbus-sensors. In the EM repository are a set of json-schema files that define what EM can expose and what the applications can consume. If you want to add a new property such as `SlotId`, this first needs to be added to the json-schema in the EM repository. The point of _that_ exercise is that you get agreement from the community on whether this is an acceptable idea.
Thanks Andrew! Here is the link of EM schema update for "SlotId":https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/74072
Thanks. Can you please integrate that link into your commit message?
I added the link into commit message, thank you for the advice!
Done

Have you thought about have different service instance for different host, i.e. have psusensor0.service, psusensor1.service etc? I am not suggesting it, rather just would like to know if you considered the option or not.

Hi Zhikui,
No, I didn't consider the option you pointed. Does it need multiple configs if there're different service instances?

I assume each host has the same set of sensors. Some examples in openbmc projects here:
https://github.com/openbmc/x86-power-control/blame/master/service_files/xyz.openbmc_project.Chassis.Control.Power%40.service

https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-state-manager/+/51465
The case we met is that psu sensors (hot-swap controller of each host) in the same power board, so we need slotId to indicate the hsc is for which host.
Got it. Thanks
which slotId is this newState for?
The newState is from the callback function of each slot. But I found HwmonTempSensor didn't get slotId in createSensors(), let me fix it and re-push patch.
Fixed by patchset13.
Why are these not replaced by vector below?
I think it can be replaced, I'll modify it and push the patch. Thanks!
Modified by patchset13.
need to test it is valid. Multiple places in this patch
Do you have suggestion that we can test if it is valid?
if (it != powerStatusOn.end())
Thanks for the suggestion!
on?
Done, thanks for the notice.😊
*Entity-Manager
Why? I think you want to skip when the match has already been created for the slotNumber. But I don't think this logic is correct
I assume the match vector should be created in order, I think if the slotNumber is less than vector size, it means the corresponding element is created.
This is a poor assumption because we can have less slots populated than the slot you are checking for.  (what if only slot 8 has a device in it?)
can we captured the slotId als, so you can add slotId as a parameter to hostStatusCallback
Done

Ideally "newState" here is for a host with a particular "slotId", there is no need to do isChassisOn(sensor->slotId), only need to find all sensors with the slotId.

And your logic is not quite right: for exaample chassis1 powerState changed to be on while chassis2 powerState was on already, but did not change, activate should be called only for chassis1 sensor. But, if I read it correctly, your logic here will call sensor->activate for both chassis1 and chassis2 sensors.
Done
this is already part of base class sensor, no need to duplicate
got it, also fixed other derived classes.
newState should be for this slotId already, no need to call again. Same in other places

Modified to
```
if ((slotId == sensor->slotId) && (type == PowerState::chassisOn))
```
should this be vector or map since path is expected to be unique, right?
Yes, the path of chassis/host is expected to be unique.
Sorry, I meant if path is unique this should be a map with path as the key. It would ensure the uniqueness and easier to find with "path"
I changed the vector to an unordered_map and removed unnecessary functions from the previous patch.
can this be just path
can this be just path
Done
Done
const size_t
Done
should one be created and added to container?
Both getPowerStatus() and getPostStatus() are called after vector powerStatusOn and biosHasPost are added new element. I don't think it need to create for the container if "it" does not exist.
const
Done

should one be created if does not exist
same in other places also
Done
why not use VariantToUnsignedIntVisitor ?
Because the slotId is defined as string in schema of entity-manager.
Since it is in base class, slotId does not have to be added to the derived class. Please check all the derived classes
Done
How does an individual HostSystem instance know its slot ID?

1. Did you verify that sensors with a different slotID are not affected by chassis7 state? Please add that result
2. Did you verify that sensors without slotID are linked to chassis0 power state? Please add that result
Seems ok to me.
Only couple minor suggestions
If these are no longer singletons, then these should no longer be global variables.  Wrap these in an appropriate class and instantiate with the sensors.
nit, use std::format here.
Pass size_t by value.  Many other cases need fixed as well.
move before use, i.e. line551
stoi throws an exception that appears to be unhandled in this code.  Use from_chars, or handle these as strings.

Lets not make this lambda any worse until it's refactored into a normal method.

This diff is basically impossible to tell what changed.
Same here why are reference used here, it can be just pass by value IMO
Why use reference here? this can be just pass by value IMO
